page.title: 17Recreation _ Leck area
page.content: {IN THE PAST}From talking to older people in our village we discovered that the old Fraser Institute,now the estate office, was once a thriving billiards club attended by lots of farm men and villagers. This was also used as a library,and for village meetings and social events. There were football,cricket,tennis,and bowling clubs. Over the years these have been abandoned through lack of interest or the falling population. {NOWADAYS}We asked people in our survey what they did in their spare time.Out of doors, the most popular activity was gardening followed by fell- walking, sport, shooting, photography, fishing and sailing. Indoor activities included reading, knitting and sewing, singing, bellringing, flower arranging,model making, drawing, dancing and television.
